issue.title: Does the flag --native-build-type Debug work properly?
issue.body:
I am building the VK-CTS for android using the following command:

```
python scripts/android/build_apk.py --sdk ~/Android/Sdk --ndk ~/Android/Sdk/ndk/26.1.10909125/ --native-build-type Debug
```


The reason is that I want to try to debug the code, but when I pass ```--native-build-type Debug``` and try to run one of the tests as below:

```
adb shell "am start -n com.drawelements.deqp/android.app.NativeActivity -e cmdLine 'deqp --deqp-case=dEQP-VK.draw.dynamic_rendering.partial_secondary_cmd_buff.implicit_sample_shading.sample_id_static_use --deqp-log-filename=/sdcard/vk_cts/test.qpa'"
```
the test.qpa result is corrupted as below. This is the entire result, it gets cut off.

```
#sessionInfo releaseName vulkan-cts-1.3.7.0-129-g4340e6e70bc62746e7cd03e8d03541e446f4f17f
#sessionInfo releaseId 0x4340e6e7
#sessionInfo targetName "Android"
#sessionInfo commandLineParameters "deqp --deqp-case=dEQP-VK.draw.dynamic_rendering.partial_secondary_cmd_buff.implicit_sample_shading.sample_id_static_use --deqp-log-filename=/sdcard/vk_cts/release.qpa"

#beginSession

#beginTestCaseResult dEQP-VK.draw.dynamic_rendering.partial_secondary_cmd_buff.implicit_sample_shading.sample_id_static_use
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<TestCaseResult Version="0.3.4" CasePath="dEQP-VK.draw.dynamic_rendering.partial_secondary_cmd_buff.implicit_sample_shading.sample_id_static_use" CaseType="SelfValidate">
 <Section Name="frag" Description="Program: frag
 ```

But when I build without the flag:

```
python scripts/android/build_apk.py --sdk ~/Android/Sdk --ndk ~/Android/Sdk/ndk/26.1.10909125/
```

the .qpa file looks correct.

Is this expected? How can build the source in debug?

thank you very much for your time.
Gustavo.

payload.description: Khronos Vulkan, OpenGL, and OpenGL ES Conformance Tests

issue.title: `dEQP-VK.api.version_check.entry_points` wrongly assumes `vkCmdPushDescriptorSetWithTemplateKHR()` presence
issue.body:
I believe I have found a CTS bug.

On a Vulkan 1.0 driver with `VK_KHR_descriptor_update_template` but no `VK_KHR_push_descriptor` support, `dEQP-VK.api.version_check.entry_points` still fails with:

```
 <Text>Enabled extensions check - tries to get functions of supported extensions from proper vkGet*ProcAddr.</Text>
 <Text>[0] vkGetDeviceProcAddr(device, "vkCmdPushDescriptorSetWithTemplateKHR") returned nullptr. Should return valid function address.</Text>
 <Text>Failed</Text>
```

https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/vkCmdPushDescriptorSetWithTemplateKHR.html mentions that the function is provided by `VK_KHR_descriptor_update_template with VK_KHR_push_descriptor` so both extensions should be checked before attempting to get the function.

I believe the current logic ends up adding the function check based on just `VK_KHR_descriptor_update_template` rather than checking `VK_KHR_push_descriptor` as well.
https://github.com/KhronosGroup/VK-GL-CTS/blob/4340e6e70bc62746e7cd03e8d03541e446f4f17f/external/vulkancts/modules/vulkan/api/vktApiVersionCheck.cpp#L244-L254

I found this while running CTS 1.3.4.1 after implementing `VK_KHR_descriptor_update_template` on the `powervr` Mesa driver.

issue.title: dEQP-VK.api.version_check.entry_points wrongly assumes `vkCmdPushDescriptorSetWithTemplateKHR()` presence
issue.body:
I believe I have found a CTS bug.

On a Vulkan 1.0 driver with `VK_KHR_descriptor_update_template` but no `VK_KHR_push_descriptor` support, `dEQP-VK.api.version_check.entry_points` still fails with:

```
 <Text>Enabled extensions check - tries to get functions of supported extensions from proper vkGet*ProcAddr.</Text>
 <Text>[0] vkGetDeviceProcAddr(device, "vkCmdPushDescriptorSetWithTemplateKHR") returned nullptr. Should return valid function address.</Text>
 <Text>Failed</Text>
```

https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/vkCmdPushDescriptorSetWithTemplateKHR.html mentions that the function is provided by `VK_KHR_descriptor_update_template with VK_KHR_push_descriptor` so both extensions should be checked before attempting to get the function.

I believe the current logic ends up adding the function check based on just `VK_KHR_descriptor_update_template` rather than checking `VK_KHR_push_descriptor` as well.
https://github.com/KhronosGroup/VK-GL-CTS/blob/4340e6e70bc62746e7cd03e8d03541e446f4f17f/external/vulkancts/modules/vulkan/api/vktApiVersionCheck.cpp#L244-L254

I found this while running CTS 1.3.4.1 after implementing `VK_KHR_descriptor_update_template` on the `powervr` Mesa driver.

issue.title: Use explicit modifer in importing exporting cases
issue.body:
According to the [spec](https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VK_EXT_image_drm_format_modifier.html) of drm modifier, the imported image should  be created with explicit modifier with subresource layouts and other information provided by the application. However, the current code base doesn't use explicit modifiers in the 'test exportImportMemoryExplicitModifiersCase'. As a result, the paths around VK_STRUCTURE_TYPE_IMAGE_DRM_FORMAT_MODIFIER_EXPLICIT_CREATE_INFO_EXT in an implementation are not covered as intended. 

@llandwerlin-intel @nchery-intel

comment.body:
[![CLA assistant check](https://cla-assistant.io/pull/badge/not_signed)](https://cla-assistant.io/KhronosGroup/VK-GL-CTS?pullRequest=422)
Thank you for your submission! We really appreciate it. Like many open source projects, we ask that you sign our [Contributor License Agreement](https://cla-assistant.io/KhronosGroup/VK-GL-CTS?pullRequest=422) before we can accept your contribution.
You have signed the CLA already but the status is still pending? Let us [recheck](https://cla-assistant.io/check/KhronosGroup/VK-GL-CTS?pullRequest=422) it.

pull_request.title: Use explicit modifer in importing exporting cases
pull_request.body:
According to the [spec](https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VK_EXT_image_drm_format_modifier.html) of drm modifier, the imported image should  be created with explicit modifier with subresource layouts and other information provided by the application. However, the current code base doesn't use explicit modifiers in the 'test exportImportMemoryExplicitModifiersCase'. As a result, the paths around VK_STRUCTURE_TYPE_IMAGE_DRM_FORMAT_MODIFIER_EXPLICIT_CREATE_INFO_EXT in an implementation are not covered as intended. 

@llandwerlin-intel @nchery-intel

issue.title: can I build and debug dEQP.apk with android studio?
issue.body:
Hi,

I am able to build the CTS vulkan dEQP.apk  on Linux and I wonder if it possible to build it from android studio and debug the conformance tests?

I was able to build from command line as below:

```
'lib/x86/libdeqp.so'...
 'lib/x86_64/libdeqp.so'...

Built /tmp/deqp-android-build/package/dEQP.apk
gustavo@ubuntu:~/VK-GL-CTS$ python scripts/android/build_apk.py --sdk ~/Android/Sdk --ndk ~/Android/Sdk/ndk/25.2.9519653/
```

However, I tried to open (I am not even sure if this is the correct gradle) the android_gradle project under:

```
gustavo@ubuntu:~/VK-GL-CTS/external/amber/src/android_gradle$
```

I get this error

```
C/C++: /home/gustavo/VK-GL-CTS/external/amber/src/CMakeLists.txt debug|armeabi-v7a : CMake Error at /home/gustavo/VK-GL-CTS/external/amber/src/third_party/CMakeLists.txt:19 (add_subdirectory):
  add_subdirectory given source
  "/home/gustavo/VK-GL-CTS/external/amber/src/third_party/googletest" which
  is not an existing directory.
```

![image](https://github.com/KhronosGroup/VK-GL-CTS/assets/15689820/0b5bfdb9-31d3-4432-875d-f99295711745)

and under the third_party/ I see nothing.

```
gustavo@ubuntu:~/VK-GL-CTS/external/amber/src/third_party$ ls
Android.mk  CMakeLists.txt
gustavo@ubuntu:~/VK-GL-CTS/external/amber/src/third_party$ 
```

How I get the dependencies? Do I have to clone differently?

If anyone is building with Android studio and able to debug the tests within Android studio, mind sharing the step?

thank you very much for your help.

issue.title: Trying to build deqp-vk from source but failing.
issue.body:
Hi, I am trying to build the vulkna VK-CTS apk from source for *Android on Windows* but hitting some problems.

Here is what I did following the steps here:

https://github.com/KhronosGroup/VK-GL-CTS/blob/main/external/vulkancts/README.md

1. Close the source with:

git clone https://github.com/KhronosGroup/VK-GL-CTS

2.  Installed the SDK/NDK tools via the android studio SDK manager

![image](https://github.com/KhronosGroup/VK-GL-CTS/assets/15689820/0d804dc2-b004-407f-8672-46819c9257ed)

3. Installed the pip packages

python -m pip install lxml

4. Fetched the sources

python external/fetch_sources.py

5. the tried to build but failed as below

PS C:\gmmo\VK-GL-CTS> python scripts/android/build_apk.py --sdk C:\Users\ogust\AppData\Local\Android\Sdk\sources\android-28 --ndk C:\Users\ogust\AppData\Local\Android\Sdk\ndk\25.2.9519653

ERROR: Failed to find build tools for CMake

Please check your configuration:
  --sdk=C:\Users\ogust\AppData\Local\Android\Sdk\sources\android-28
  --ndk=C:\Users\ogust\AppData\Local\Android\Sdk\ndk\25.2.9519653


Can anyone please show me what I am doing wrong?

thank you very much.

comment.body:
No, I definitely have it.

```
PS C:\gmmo\VK-GL-CTS> python scripts/android/build_apk.py --sdk C:\Users\ogust\AppData\Local\Android\Sdk\sources\android-28 --ndk C:\Users\ogust\AppData\Local\Android\Sdk\ndk\25.2.9519653
ERROR: Failed to find build tools for CMake

Please check your configuration:
  --sdk=C:\Users\ogust\AppData\Local\Android\Sdk\sources\android-28
  --ndk=C:\Users\ogust\AppData\Local\Android\Sdk\ndk\25.2.9519653
PS C:\gmmo\VK-GL-CTS> cmake --version
cmake version 3.26.0-rc5

CMake suite maintained and supported by Kitware (kitware.com/cmake).
PS C:\gmmo\VK-GL-CTS>
```

New tests:
dEQP-VK.api.device_init.create_device_unsupported_features.external_format_resolve_features_android

VK-GL-CTS issue: 4472

Change-Id: I989376279a9ee7b3ca6da24ed1adfccedfbd5a77

Advance glslang to fix link error for ndk26

Component: Vulkan
VK-GL-CTS issue: 4570

Change-Id: I4bb72d6a2ed876f3dff9d81196b6e489854cefea

Add tests to force draw support for all AHB formats

Components: Vulkan

dEQP-VK.api.external.memory.android_hardware_buffer.external_format_resolve.*

VK-GL-CTS issue: 4472

Change-Id: I5f971666c80fa9948c85082145ab568e07d13022

Merge branch 'main' into dev/VK_ANDROID_external_format_resolve

Change-Id: Iadeaf6b4e89bebe175a35ba6486f13a6f1187c23

Render tests for VK_ANDROID_external_format_resolve

 - Clear test to ensure correct clear load
 - Checkerboard draw test
 - Input attachment after draw test
 - Dynamic tests

Components: Vulkan
New tests:
dEQP-VK.draw.*.ahb_external_format_resolve.*

VK-GL-CTS issue: 4472

Change-Id: I07d22fdd0580a329ab5263db803b7f25885ca395

Merge branch 'dev/VK_ANDROID_external_format_resolve'

Change-Id: I45815d6688ab247b004625bfba5f81060790aee4
Merge "Merge branch 'dev/VK_ANDROID_external_format_resolve'" into main

Fix an unused variable warning in release mode

No functional change.

Affects:
dEQP-VK.video.decode.*

Components: Vulkan

Change-Id: I464911f16c80870ea72b772dd22aa512c85d65e1

Fix duplicated files in cmakelists.txt

Components: Framework

VK-GL-CTS issue: 4730

Change-Id: I463b65eb9ba19e22bce976458d1f03f06f5d6edd

Simplify BorderSwizzle TestNode

These were storing both the depthStencil and color clear values for all
nodes when only 1 was ever used. This is a bit confusing, inconsistent
with normal Vulkan usage and wasteful of memory. (There are around
385,000 of these tests, so this amounts to about a 3Mb saving).

Components: Vulkan
VK-GL-CTS issue: 4681
Affects: dEQP-VK.pipeline.*.sampler.border_swizzle.*

Change-Id: Ifd26e597ab0c038b775f93796ecc40df69ca6cb6

Improve compile times of some generated glsl tests

Some generated tests used a high number of logical 'and'
operations which resulted in slow compile times on the slow
cpu platforms.
To address this resultVar is moved on the RHS of && operator
which will result in trivial if statement that will get
flattened in the compile process, avoiding the perf traps
on some compilers.
Additional counter was also added to limit the number of generated
compare operations per shader. This limit will trigger only in a
few cases out of thousands.

Components: Vulkan

VK-GL-CTS issue: 2658

Affects:
dEQP-VK.memory_model.shared.*
dEQP-VK.ssbo.phys.layout.*
dEQP-VK.binding_model.buffer_device_address.*

Change-Id: I5a9e3f87b737ed83b109bf7b90e5aeea8928c458

Remove the custom device code in the copies and blitting tests

It doesn't appear to be necessary, since the only things needed in
addition to the default device are an exclusive compute and transfer
queue.

These can be simply queried when the default device is being created,
and then queried from the test cases. There are more instances of test
cases creating custom devices only for an alternative queue.

There was also code related to getting profile specific device drivers
that was unused, it appeared.

With utility methods in place for queue selection, this patch also
cleans up a lot of code dealing with multi-queue cases. It has fixed
several instances of,

VUID-vkCmdCopyBufferToImage-commandBuffer-07739

There are also reports of,

VUID-VkCopyBufferToImageInfo2-pRegions-00171

But they have been triaged as validation bugs. See
https://github.com/KhronosGroup/Vulkan-ValidationLayers/issues/6681

Affects:
dEQP-VK.api.copy_and_blit.*
dEQP-VKSC.api.copy_and_blit.*

Components: Vulkan, Framework

VK-GL-CTS issue: 4718

Change-Id: I9406e079ded91055437f38eaefd34ebedbea165a

Add tests for inherithed framebuffers with VK_EXT_depth_bias_control.

New and affected tests:
dEQP-VK.rasterization.depth_bias_control.*_secondary_cmd_buffer_inherit_renderpass
dEQP-VK.rasterization.depth_bias_control.*_secondary_cmd_buffer_unspecified_fb

Components: Vulkan
VK-GL-CTS issue: 4650

Change-Id: I792348184ab4a3301a533f3e0c507a3779a95840

Tests for sparse resources on transfer queue

Added basic set of tests for transfer queue operations on sparse resource images.

Affects:

dEQP-VK.sparse_resources.transfer_queue.*

VK-GL-CTS issue: 3768

Components: Vulkan

Change-Id: Ia500d7b3246cf8eaeb8228c438c67f443539848d

Remove redundant ESO and feedback loop layout tests

These tests have a static variant and two dynamic variants, but the two
dynamic variants are identical when using shader objects.

Removed tests:
dEQP-VK.pipeline.shader_object_*.attachment_feedback_loop_layout.*_dynamic_bad_static

VK-GL-CTS issue: 4719
Components: Vulkan

Change-Id: Icc0b58c954d98fe6be972d07a21a8a6d3013f53b

Simplifying changes to spirv_assembly test structure

 * Don't check extensions where the features are already checked
 * Simplify descriptor setup for compute cases
 * Simplify logic around float_controls feature additions. (This is
   probably still too complex, but finding the correct conditions for
   setting up these flags will have to wait for another change)

Components: Vulkan
Affects: dEQP-VK.spirv_assembly.instruction.compute.*
         dEQP-VK.spirv_assembly.instruction.*.float_controls.*

Change-Id: I7705936230d35adf087bc560081e48a06bbe2fef

Enable device features for *device_memory_report.create_and_destroy*

Fixes VUID-VkImageViewCreateInfo-viewType-01004 in
dEQP-VK.memory.device_memory_report.create_and_destroy_object.image_view_cube_arr

Affects:
dEQP-VK.memory.device_memory_report.create_and_destroy_object.*

Components: Vulkan
VK-GL-CTS issue: 4337

Change-Id: I8b7d137308bdf85c9cd41da349b52928cd9684ec

Do not use and check for STORAGE image support, when it is not used in the test

This reverts 37e64193 and provides alternate fix, without making the
tests not supported on some platforms.

Storing to the image is not used in this test, so it does not need to
be checked for support and requested for images.

VK-GL-CTS Issue: 4667

Affected tests:
dEQP-VK.sparse_resources.image_block_shapes.*

Components: Vulkan
Change-Id: I0e11b15042fc5687482a1ed103c1acae16f6d40a

Merge vk-gl-cts/vulkan-cts-1.3.2 into vk-gl-cts/vulkan-cts-1.3.3

Change-Id: Ibe8344fb28c575f611f560b05e21fe15cd95defd

Merge vk-gl-cts/vulkan-cts-1.3.3 into vk-gl-cts/vulkan-cts-1.3.4

Change-Id: Id977001c7bfafd04aa00b1ec42f868833f942811

Fix dynamic state "clear" tests sync issues

There's a write-after-write hazard when the tests perform two image
layout transfers from undefined to general, with a transfer operation in
between.

Affects:
dEQP-VK.dynamic_state.*

Components: Vulkan
VK-GL-CTS issue: 4715

Change-Id: I6a1ec6b3d400d737a6affa64b6db04830031ca24

Merge vk-gl-cts/vulkan-cts-1.3.4 into vk-gl-cts/vulkan-cts-1.3.5

Change-Id: Ibc19cbff2556d20674b89aa5ce4025cbdd5a638e

Merge vk-gl-cts/vulkan-cts-1.3.5 into vk-gl-cts/vulkan-cts-1.3.6

Change-Id: I54f8169b05322851b0f9084b2bb2dd43a6335eab

Merge vk-gl-cts/vulkan-cts-1.3.6 into vk-gl-cts/vulkan-cts-1.3.7

Change-Id: I60c472afe664e81536470cf1cb275ad6e1005720

Fix support checks in attachment feedback loop layout tests

The main change is making sure attachment_feedback_loop_dynamic_state is
supported for shader object variants.

In addition, the commit contains several improvements to the support
checks in these tests:

* Check the pipeline construction requirements earlier.
* Remove check for the attachmentFeedbackLoopLayout feature, which is
  mandatory if the main extension is supported.
* Improve and simplify format feature checks.

Affects:
dEQP-VK.pipeline.*.attachment_feedback_loop_layout.*

VK-GL-CTS issue: 4711
Components: Vulkan

Change-Id: I6cc6dac663198401b17276706917096380d37848

Set the binding mesh shader stage when testing mesh shaders

Without this change the pipeline was being created where the
mesh shader used the set=0,binding=0 SSBO resource but
there was no binding in the descriptor layout for this
shader stage.

Affected test:
dEQP-VK.shader_object.binding.bindings_mesh_shaders

VK-GL-CTS issue: 4707

Components: Vulkan
Change-Id: Iede3a425109b71a93b25025a6bef54d5d003866d

Check for extension before quering format properties

The check for extension needs to happen before querying format
properties with vkGetPhysicalDeviceImageFormatProperties, otherwise the
valiation layers will report an unrecognized format

Components: Vulkan

VK-GL-CTS issue: 4731

Affected tests:
dEQP-VK.api.copy_and_blit.*

Change-Id: I59cb33a9e793188960ca59ea796b2d60c545c8cc

Respect robustBufferAccess2 in bind_buffers_2 tests

Although support for VK_EXT_robustness2 was being checked
the robustBufferAccess2 support within that extension was not.

This would result in the tests incorrectly running (and failing)
rather than reporting as not supported on devices that don't
support robustBufferAccess2.

Components: Vulkan
VK-GL-CTS issue: 4732
Affects: dEQP-VK.pipeline.*.bind_buffers_2.maintenance5.robustness2.*

Change-Id: Ief77a3f4264054892ebcde01c3693ddb189bbe47

Remove all test cases descriptions to reduce memory footprint

Removes all the descriptions from all Vulkan tests. Descriptions were only printed in the XML file, and not as part of the test results.
In many cases, descriptions were just repeating the same information present in the test case name. In other cases they had useful information, which can be moved to comments.

I've validated this by comparing the output of ./deqp-vk --deqp-caselist-file=external/vulkancts/mustpass/main/vk-default.txt --deqp-log-images=disable --deqp-log-shader-sources=disable  --deqp-runmode=txt-caselist between BEFORE and AFTER this change, and there are no differences.

Components: Framework, Vulkan, OpenGL
VK-GL-CTS issue: 4681
Affects: *

Change-Id: I2ce565b02975dd297f896568313dd9bcb850f9a4

VK-GL-CTS issue: 4337

Change-Id: I8b7d137308bdf85c9cd41da349b52928cd9684ec

Do not use and check for STORAGE image support, when it is not used in the test

This reverts 37e64193 and provides alternate fix, without making the
tests not supported on some platforms.

Storing to the image is not used in this test, so it does not need to
be checked for support and requested for images.

VK-GL-CTS Issue: 4667

Affected tests:
dEQP-VK.sparse_resources.image_block_shapes.*

issue.title: merge consecutive lines when stippling
issue.body:
When we draw the reference images, we split line segments into single-pixel length line segment, and we consider the stipple pattern for each segment individually. This leads to close to every covered pixel being considered an edge pixel, because we draw rectangles that are a single pixel long.

We should merge the consecutive line segments before rasterizing them, so the filled portions are considered as a whole.

Without this, the line-stippling tests are close to pointless; very close to every single covered pixel is allowed to be either filled or not, leading to very very few pixels actually being tested.

comment.body:
Here's an old MR I wrote when debugging CTS failures on Lavapipe... I guess it should be upstreamed.

I don't expect this to cause any regressions on real drivers, because there are *some* pixels being tested per segment, and it would be very unlikely that a driver would cover those but not the ones that are completely uncovered by accident. But I haven't tested this on much HW.

pull_request.title: merge consecutive lines when stippling
pull_request.body:
When we draw the reference images, we split line segments into single-pixel length line segment, and we consider the stipple pattern for each segment individually. This leads to close to every covered pixel being considered an edge pixel, because we draw rectangles that are a single pixel long.

We should merge the consecutive line segments before rasterizing them, so the filled portions are considered as a whole.

Without this, the line-stippling tests are close to pointless; very close to every single covered pixel is allowed to be either filled or not, leading to very very few pixels actually being tested.

repo.name: VK-GL-CTS
repo.description: Khronos Vulkan, OpenGL, and OpenGL ES Conformance Tests

repo.name: VK-GL-CTS
repo.description: Khronos Vulkan, OpenGL, and OpenGL ES Conformance Tests

issue.title: how to classify those cases into hardware testing and  software testing?
issue.body: There are many cases in the vk-default.txt file in VK-GL-CTS, which mix software and hardware cases. But I don't know the naming rules for these cases, so I can't classify them. Do you have any good methods?

comment.body: No, VK-GL-CTS validates that an implementation conforms to the Vulkan API. Since the API doesn't say which parts of it must/should be implemented in HW and  the CTS can't obtain this knowledge from anywhere, there is no classification of tests you are looking for,

issue.title: how to classify those cases into hardware testing and  software testing?
issue.body: There are many cases in the vk-default.txt file in VK-GL-CTS, which mix software and hardware cases. But I don't know the naming rules for these cases, so I can't classify them. Do you have any good methods?

comment.body:
> The Vulkan specification does not impose any requirements on which parts of the API should be hardware accelerated. It's up to an implementation. FWIW, the entire specification can be implemented in software (eg https://github.com/google/swiftshader).

yes ,it's right. But in this project, not only software testing, but also hardware testing. Such as vulkan api  specification check，etc.

issue.title: how to classify those cases into hardware testing and  software testing?
issue.body: There are many cases in the vk-default.txt file in VK-GL-CTS, which mix software and hardware cases. But I don't know the naming rules for these cases, so I can't classify them. Do you have any good methods?
